DataElement.preferredName: Disabilities of the Arm Shoulder and Hand Outcome Measure Disability Symptom Total Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value representing the total score of the Disability/Symptom portion of the Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder and Hand Outcome measure, a 30-item, self-reported questionnaire designed to measure physical and social function along with symptom impact associated with musculosketetal disorders of the upper limb.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disabilities of the Arm Shoulder and Hand Outcome Measure Assessment Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 30-item, self-reported questionnaire designed to measure physical and social function along with symptom impact associated with musculosketetal disorders of the upper limb._Having determined the value, significance, or extent of._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.longName: Disabilities of the Arm Shoulder and Hand Outcome Measure

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Disabilities of the Arm Shoulder and Hand Outcome Measure Disability Symptom Total Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A 30-item, self-reported questionnaire designed to measure physical and social function along with symptom impact associated with musculosketetal disorders of the upper limb._Any physical, mental, or functional impairment that limits a major activity.  It may be partial or complete. (Taber's)_An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: Disabilities of the Arm Shoulder and Hand Outcome Measure
Concepts.definition: A 30-item, self-report questionnaire designed to measure physical and social function along with symptom impact associated with musculoskeletal disorders of the upper limb.
Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for NCI CCR Protocol in C3D.
